column4: After a kernel update in 8.10 from 2.6.27.9 to 2.6.27.11 my wireless broke. I use a broadcom wireless with the b43 module. Worked perfectly before update, but now I cant connect with DHCP and must manually set IP, and the connection is incredibly unstable (actually useless, but there) Any help?
you have to use the proprietary drivers for that card
let me try and locate it
um yea...i had that same problem actually
got instructions on how to fix it?
i had to reactivate the b43fwcutter thing
yea...how fast did u get with this card before because they do kind of suck
make sure the card is in managed mode
and change the tx power of it to the highest
is it possible you have more than one interface for that card
did you try the broadcom STA drivers
you dont have a hardware drivers utility in system, administration?

we need to blacklist it,  it's called ssb
and blacklist the b43 module too

okay edit /etc/network/interfaces to reflect that eth1 is your wireless interface

iwconfig will list all the wireless interfaces

it should be obvious...you probably have an entry for ur old wlan0 interface...just change that
flip the switch for the card once...see if that helps
those r usually mini-pci's for laptops
do u know what pan0 is?
it was in ur /etc/network interfaces right?
can you bring the card up... ifconfig eth1 up ?
i thought u said you had an eth1 when you did iwconfig
you have eth0, vmnet0, pan0, .....what else
i switched to that and mine is working great now
